nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The pine torch has burnt out. You stand silently in the dark, gradually seeing the moonlight's brightness. A rat gnaws at the pot lid—crunch, crunch—a noise that grates on your nerves.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: You push the rat down. It floats up, scratching the wall, its small sharp red nose gasping hurriedly—sniff, sniff. It looks detestable.

nodes.speaker: Mother
nodes.text: Your mother sits in the grey-white moonlight, her body seeming to tremble. Her low voice contains infinite sorrow: "The water in the jar has been boiling for some time. But your nature... neither cold nor hot, changing not a bit."

choices.text: I am waiting for the time.

nodes.speaker: Mother
nodes.text: She fixes you with eyes flashing in the dim light. "Your father spent three whole years of his spirit to forge two swords. A jet of white vapor rushed up, turning crimson and casting a peach-blossom glow. But he knew: tears can never wash away fate."

choices.text: Why did he have to die?

nodes.speaker: Mother
nodes.text: "Good. The iron is cold, but the blood is still hot." She points to the rotten wood beneath the bed. "Take the bundle. Dig."

nodes.speaker: Mother
nodes.text: "Knowledge is a heavy burden. But if that is your will..." She sighs, a long, soft sound of disappointment. "Take the bundle. Go. The cock has crowed."
